constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 42 (Wednesday, March 9, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. BOEBERT:
H.R. 7012.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article l, Section 8-The Congress shall have power to lay
and collect taxes, duties, imposts and excises, to pay the
debts and provide for the common defense and general welfare
of the United States; but all duties, imposts and excises
shall be uniform throughout the United States;
Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2-The Congress shall have
Power to dispose of and make all needful Rules and
Regulations respecting the Territory or other Property
belonging to the United States.
[Page H1424]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.
